intro: Corydalis homopetala, commonly known as the Chinese larkspur, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Corydalis homopetala is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
